pkgmetadata.longdescription: Biterm Topic Models for Short Text // Biterm Topic Models find topics in collections of short texts. It is a word co- occurrence based topic model that learns topics by modeling word-word co-occurrences patterns which are called biterms. This in contrast to traditional topic models like Latent Dirichlet Allocation and Probabilistic Latent Semantic Analysis which are word-document co-occurrence topic models. A biterm consists of two words co-occurring in the same short text window. This context window can for example be a twitter message, a short answer on a survey, a sentence of a text or a document identifier. The techniques are explained in detail in the paper 'A Biterm Topic Model For Short Text' by Xiaohui Yan, Jiafeng Guo, Yanyan Lan, Xueqi Cheng (2013) https://github.com/ xiaohuiyan/xiaohuiyan.github.io/blob/master/paper/BTM- WWW13.pdf.
